intro: Chamaefistula crotalarioides, commonly known as the yellow ghost tree, is a shrub-like plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its yellow, waxy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually covered in a fine layer of white hairs. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
